intro: Erigeron naudinii, commonly known as the Naudin's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron naudinii is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments with minimal water requirements.
